Dates

Dates: May 16-18, 2019

Venue

Venue: Ida Noyes Hall at 1212 East 59th Street.

Program (updated on April 9)

The conference program is available for download.

List of abstracts

The abstracts of all the presentations and posters are available below:

Day 1 (May 16)

Lexical Iconicity in American Sign Language
Invited Speaker: Karen Emmorey (San Diego State University)

The Grammar of the Body: Insights about Language from Sign Language
Invited Speaker: Wendy Sandler (The University of Haifa)


The Curious Case of Measure Semantics
Yagmur Sag

The Limits between Negative Polarity and Negative Concord. A Reference to Basque
M.Teresa Espinal, Urtzi Etxeberria & Susagna Tubau

Effects of creator role on binding into Picture Noun Phrases
Shannon Bryant & Isabelle Charnavel

Semantic Effects on Processing Filler-Gap Dependencies into Adjuncts and Conjuncts
Annika Kohrt, Peter O’Neill & Dustin Chacón

Scope Changing Mechanisms & the Availability of Scrambling in Polish Ditransitives
Paulina Lęska

Subcomparatives: Across-the-board Binding of Two Degree Variables by a Single Quantifier
Laura Vela-Plo

The Discourse Status of Implicit Objects: Evidence from Language Production
Ana Besserman & Elsi Kaiser

Pronominal Binding in Weak Crossover: An Eye-Tracking Study
Jun Lyu

A-movement feeds licensing: Evidence from Indirect Causatives in Sason Arabic
Faruk Akkus

Successive-Cyclic Wh-Movement Feeds Dependent Case Competition
Rafael Abramovitz

Seeing Possible Worlds
Serpil Karabuklu & Ronnie B. Wilbur

The Well-formedness and the Ill-formedness of the JSL Type-III Syllable
Daisuke Hara & Makoto Miwa

Optional subject marking in Chitimacha
Daniel Hieber

Grammaticalization of verb ‘take’ in Twi and aspectual construalization: Functional implications
Taegyeong Lee

Simultaneity vs Sequentiality: Serial Verb Constructions at the intersection. Agents in Motion Predicates
Elena Benedicto

Three Signs, One Common Trait: ‘All’ A study on universal quantifiers in Turkish Sign Language
Burcu Saral & Meltem Kelepir

Mandarin GIVE-marked Benefactives and the Syntax and Semantics of Double Object Constructions
Jianrong Yu

A question denotation for the Dravidian correlative
Rahul Balusu

Contrastive Topic and directionality: A comparative analysis of CT markers in Persian
Wataru Okubo

Factive and manner-of-speaking islands are an artifact of nonlinearity in the acceptability judgment task
Yingtong Liu, Rachel Ryskin, Richard Futrell & Edward Gibson

Semantic Decomposition of Verbs and the Processing and Production of Result States
Sarah Hye-Yeon Lee & Elsi Kaiser

The Distribution of Parentheticals is not (Purely) Syntactic!
Andrew McInnerney

What you see is what you get: A few arguments for isomorphic sluicing in ASL
Elena Koulidobrova and Elena Zidani-Eroglu

Predicate-fronting and animacy in Burmese
Keely New

Goal Oriented Location Commands
Michael Donovan
